Writing, editing, revising, querying/publishing, and shelving is a vicious cycle of self doubt. You're opening yourself to that doubt at every step in the process.

That's the real bravery right there, being afraid and doing it anyway. You big damn hero.

When I reread something I wrote an age ago, and that tingling sense of losing myself to a story almost stops me editing. I almost want to leave a comment to joyously scream to myself over a single line.

Writing is hard, but practice pays off.

Bullies tore up

She's still right & here I am

@katheroony My partner has chronic fatigue and will regularly take a weekend nap. We ensure it hits the sleep cycle beat so no more than 90mins. If it's more then I keep it in 30 min blocks and wake him if it's more than 180.

Sometimes your body really just needs the rest.

There were plot holes & problems, it was not a waste of my time

We need to stop insisting on perfection

I dont want or need perfect. Even if there were things the inner critic can't forgive, I enjoyed it

3 stars is not bad

Remember why you started.
Don't give them something they cant take.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
I love what I do. 

I sent an email to my lovely authors.

I have some reviewing to do for my editor.

I'm meeting a most beloved editor this weekend.

No forecast of perceived failure would make me take back everything that I have gained up until this moment. 

I *love* this.

name: E. J. Dawson

tweet: @silverpebble Diagnosis, even late diagnosis, is so relieving, and its totally OK to be a big snotty mess about it. For years. And the moment you are referring to is the "click" moment. When it makes sense. Its a good feeling. üòä

tweet:
A story might not have worked out the way you wanted. It might have been rejected. It may be that you can't find what's missing to make it magical. But it isn't dead or gone. You can always come back to it later. 

#stories #writing #writingtips #trunked #writerslife #writer‚Ä¶ https://t.co/KTMzViB8vV

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Can I just tell you something?

Stories that are trunked don't die. They are asleep. Dragons hibernating. Caterpillars metamorphosing. Maybe they weren't ready. Maybe you weren't.

And when you pick them up again, years later, you'll recreate them completely, but they aren't gone

I just slid a book back on the shelf, and picked out another. My mother came up to me and said I must be on holiday. I've been here almost two weeks. I asked what made her say that now. She just realised I've read a Pratchett novel each day.

It's what holidays are for.

I see you. Thank you

tweet:
Trying to finish Nano steps;

1. Forget descriptions
2. All witty banter
3. Murder that one character for feels
4. Forget the villain is hot
5. Cut fight scenes to "they fought"
6. Throw in Vague Moral Lesson
7. Cry, throw up, coffee intraveneously
8. Remember you can stop at 50k

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @clemmiegirlnz Awww that's so lovely!

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
The scope of my, our, success can't be measured by the things we can't attain, can never control, and may never get. I can imagine my life as a lotto winner, just like I can imagine having an agent, or a book deal. 

But I can't imagine spending my time on anything else.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
It was the love of stories. Not one, not singular. All the stories, the little successes every single day. Even when its work. Even when I'm tired. Even when by the writing community's standards it's not enough.

Because it is. It makes me happy more than it makes me sad.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: Success wasn't a marker on a time line; it was the writing sprints, the feedback on whether I wrote good stories, the times were I wasn't just told I improved as a writer, but I kept people awake at night, the writing friends who screamed via DMs over my book's relationships

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: It was signing on as an intern at LW, it was accepting a manuscript to edit, it was being asked to edit another - the author *wanted* ME to edit it, it was the notes an editor left in the columns of my book crying over my writing, it was over 50 reviews on GR for the first time

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I have a wall. On it I put all the failings and success of the year. But I've come to realize for me success was in the smallest of details, things hadn't taken as wins because they were the little things that kept me going, thinking I had this, and it was work, but good work

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: But more importantly, we keep defining our version of success as to whether our books get rep, get accepted on sub, get printed, make the NYT list, when each time before we've ever written a word, so much chance at failure lies ahead of us, waiting for us with heartache and tears

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: So while I can cry for myself when I wake up every morning, and find myself congratulating people who "make it", my day already starting with what I haven't accomplished, I'm still happy for those that do. Because the chances are so slim, and we don't talk about failure enough.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: We don't talk about rejection because those subjects make us feel "down" and sad about our chances, when our chances are very slim. Few of us know the heartbreak of rejection on sub and I can't imagine the tears or the pain, but then there's the apathy during your release

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: Why be here when it takes such an emotional toil, when I work hours every day, every weekend, to keep facing these things, to expect them? Because I love writing, the value of your worth isn't in a rejection. The  weight of your soul is worth more than well liked tweet.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I've seen writers walk away from the emotional toil querying and self publishing took. People I've never heard from again. I've been rejected from volunteering, mentorships, agents, presses, panels, book bloggers, interviews, the list is endless.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I've written by a death bed, read reviews crying in the bathroom wondering what value my life had. Not my books. My life. This industry holds the weight of our souls against the money that can be made from slivers of our hearts confined to invisible rules some of us can't read

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I was one of those rejection statistics. It matched a long list. I've come to dread the words "Thank you, but". I wrote a book catering to market, & one of my soul, and both have been rejected. I've had my first paid writing gig cancelled twice. Watched my books be overlooked

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: An agent who I'd love to work with one day posted a thread of all her stats for the year and I felt like I'd have a better chance of winning the lotto than every getting rep'd. If other agents were anything like her then what chance did I ever have.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: Talking about my own failures feels like scraping too close to my bones, but for every single one who thinks its just them, and they're the one failing, read all the responses. The quote tweets. See that you aren't alone. https://t.co/Ias6zStBrs

tweet:
Sometimes, someone, breaks us.
There's no getting it back. There's no being the person we were before. We're not naive anymore.
We're jaded fragments of a mirror that reflects our worst selves.
We may be lost, and alone.
But we aren't jinxed. 
#Arcane

You dont have to write as much or as often or that specific thing every second you have spare

Write how you feel, write about that person you almost loved, write about what scares you

#amwriting

ASK.

Worst case they say no, and you might be surprised by the yes.

Every time I write a new story I rush through it. But not this time. This time I'm taking my time. I'm writing far slower to pick my words. I'm trying to save future me a lot of editing I normally have to do and I love the story more for it.

This #Nano - pick your own pace.

tweet:
Words aren't set in stone. You can revise, tweak, learn more about the writing craft which means you aren't set in stone either. 

Everything you write, book you read, time you take to learn more, is you revising the limits of what you know so you can be a better writer.

tweet:
Today I stocked up on spoons.
One silly action movie after another.
Cried my heart out at nonsense and poked a script.
These are not days you failed, these are days you recharged for all the ones to come that tax you beyond your reserves. Never feel guilty for them.

tweet:
Writing what you know is often writing with the trauma, grief, and heart aching sickness you've experienced within your own life, so while you're doing it, and then feeling guilty for it taking longer, remember that those experiences can scar you like physical wounds.

Breathe.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: How to deal with it? I try to ask why, and whether I as an individual can do something about it. Sometimes you can't do anything with the why, the world is just messed up. You can pick up the pieces, keep trying or remove yourself, as best as you can. Reach out to your support.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
For me, the "Not fair" saying comes in with the rules

We gauge society's expectations by learning the rules

When they dont work/break/bend in corrupt or even outside our scope ways, it's hard to accept after we spent so long learning them

I see it as a literal thinking pattern https://t.co/fzI3jZdPtH

Twitter has been full of really shitty takes today, so here is your reminder that;

- Indie, self, & trad is valid
- Follow who inspires you
- Nano is a comp against yourself
- Do your own research
- Writers are colleagues not competition
- Be kind

It's honestly not that hard https://t.co/jzCMUKImD4

Never ever compare your draft to someone else's book

You don't know how much they agonized over every word
How many critique partners pulled at every line
Editors scrubbing mistakes from every page
Copy editors placing final touches

Yet some things still get missed, and its OK.

@garethlpowell Aldiss won his first award in 1971 - how old were you?
Priest succeeded in 1974 - had you started writing?
McDonald was in 1992 for a short - had you published?

You WILL get there. Just because its not before or more than them right now, doesn't change your brilliance.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @LifeinFiction I find this is where you can really bring for the "B" story - something aside from the action/main plot. Like deep distrust or a betrayal, even a love subplot. Save the Cat also helped me with soggy middles.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @the_nopes I'm mutuals with an agent I've sent manuscripts to and she's written form rejections for them. We still get along and chat in DMs, just not about those books. They're people. The difference is this is their profession too, and I wasn't mutuals beforehand. Theres no harm in trying

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @the_nopes It absolutely feels like that, but having been on the other side its complicated. Yes there is an element of finding the "one" but its also about a host of other stuff thats all just out of your control. I wrote a blog on it if you're interested; https://t.co/qCDTY4AlvG

tweet: @the_nopes Oh this sucks - I've just stopped, It doesn't feel like the right script anymore and I threw it in the trunk to re-examine later and I'm keeping myself occupied with work I know will go somewhere. But not putting it out there robes you of a chance to find someone who loves it

Take a damn break. Now.

tweet:
Here's the thing about books; they don't expire

Trends change, writing style evolves. Genres fall in & out of popularity

Any novel you write can be queried today, or a year from now

Any book can be read tomorrow, or in 10 years

Dont time yourself on a clock that doesn't exist

description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Writers have to edit, polish, revise, blog, podcast, listen, tweet, instagram, FB, read, review, CP, betaread, submit, query, publish...

It's endless. You arent.
Let go of what you can't do today.
Don't spend time you dont have.
It'll still be there tomorrow.
Take care of you.

There is no way to gain enjoyment out of life at the expense of people, including yourself. Time only flies when you're lost in what you love

I did not like Squid Game. There was no lesson for me other than how I spend my time is valuable

Do what you love, with your whole heart

There is a bridge between writing as a pleasurable hobby and then deciding to seek publishing. Its taking a cake down to the county fair. Knitting a scarf to sell online. Crafting a chair for a dining set.

It's a skill, and its hard to apply skills to the heart.

Keep writing.

tweet:
When I get discouraged about writing, I just think about what else would I do if I wasn't. How else would I spend this time? When I don't like the answers, it's because I love writing, that's what keeps me going.

I'd rather do this, even feeling discouraged, than anything else.

description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Writing is hard.

The muse isn't there.
You can't find the right music.
Sometimes your heart isn't in the story.

Take a break. Read a book. Drink water.

But above all stop thinking less of yourself. This isn't just a hobby, this is a job. It's work. You're allowed to rest.

tweet:
Twitter can be a complete trashfire

There is so much pressure to strive for expectations beyond our reach

But there's love too. The people you can't find. The friends who understand. Who cherish you, your work, & your real self you never dared or could be IRL.

Be that friend.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
@hwjohnston7 Its more a case of some stories can have your complete and undivided attention, but they are just an idea you're toying with, and they dont go anywhere. And that its OK not to finish those projects. 

If you have the drive to write the story, then write it.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @hwjohnston7 If you're inspired to write then by all means, but some stories are just a spark and quickly fizzles out. There is a difference between forcing yourself to write a story that carries no emotion, and getting yourself to sit down and focus on finishing the story.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: @Dewiwrites My immediate response to that one is; Yeah? So which sports team do you follow? cause you're older than 25, burn your jersey, no more football nights for you, you can be a fan if you're over 25. https://t.co/PLUG1b32wZ

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Motivation to write flagging?

Could be that you need the story to rest. Create an aesthetic, read a book in that genre. Go write something else. Maybe you'll never come back to that story, maybe you'll be struck with inspiration. But don't force what isn't there.

Shelving projects isn't bad. Yes it can hurt. Quite a bit.

Keep editing.

tweet:
You know the story you should write?

The one that won't quit.
That wakes you at 3am.
That you forget to eat while writing.

Nothing drives a story like passion, regardless if its imperfect. You can always add perfect later.

tweet:

Don't cage yourself with one goal
Don't confine yourself with past failure
Don't cave under someone else's opinion

#amwriting

tweet: @LannahMarshall The way I figure it, I learn something I didn't know but needed to after every book I write. There is something in the book I am trying to tell myself. If its nothing more than you should be kinder to yourself thats fine, but sometimes its a lot deeper than that

name: E. J. Dawson

And that's after you've already had to acknowledge the fickleness of this industry, how out of your control getting opportunities/living in another country with very few agents gives you zero chances at meeting at conferences (obvs precovid).

It all gets pretty damn dispiriting.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Or the publishing events where agents/editors are  speaking and they aren't recorded for later/you don't get to ask/pitch anything because you can't be up at 3am on a work night.

Or even chances at be ON a panel or part of the games because you actually need sleep. 3?

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Only to be overtired and disappointed because nothing happened. You can't schedule every potential opportunity.

Or you do schedule and miss the hype cause hey I need sleep and have work but this event is only on at 1am for me & I wake 2 hours early trying to catch up
2?

But this is what must be done to do the story justice. Don't be scared of beginning; get ready for how it will feel in the end.

tweet:
They say it's darkest before the dawn like all your problems will be solved by a single cosmic event completely out of our control and inevitable as the sun.

It's a lie.

We're all stumbling in the twilight. Stop searching for light in darkness.
Become your own dawn from within.

tweet:
One of the relationships in publishing I dont understand is the sometimes not so subtle dislike of the the editor.

And I dont get it.

EVERY editor I've ever worked with reminded me why I wrote this story, why I love it, and they invigorate me when they love it too.

Write your heart project that readers will go to war for like all the die hard fans of Baz's R&J. Write for the underground cult. Write for the strangers at parties who discover mutual love in your words. Write for the kid you used to be.

tweet:
Didn't finish that novel?
Trunked due to rejections?
Got ghosted by a reviewer?

All you can do is keep going

Write the next book
Query a new story
Let go of reviews

Not everything will be up to and moving on or away from a book isn't quitting, it's growing as a writer

tweet: @JennTJarrett I've read books that were labelled as perfect and didn't finish them. I've read books you've never heard of and I still recommend them. What the reader decides isn't up to you, and that includes how great it could really be to them, and that they recommend it.

tweet:
My PC is down and while I will have a rudimentary solution (computer cannibalism) I'm temporarily stuck on the phone.

Which I was showing to the dog.

Who sneezed on it.

name: E. J. Dawson

tweet: @AspienBlue I think we start but not showing tears, until we realize that we've been hurt so many times it stops after a while. We can invest emotional energy into other peoples negativity or let it go - but that last one is hard.

tweet:
Sometimes your writing works, and sometimes it just... doesnt

Maybe you aren't ready
Or you need a break
Some TLC and mental space
An outside perspective

Whatever it is, hammering yourself into the ground as "failing" is NOT the answer
So... stop that right now

Go take a break

tweet:
@borbalabranch @authorwbwelch A letter to someone who's died
A poem to a love left behind
A story of unspoken hatred
Or an essay to our younger self

We can't dictate who stories are for more than we can force people to buy our stories. Some things can be shared, but not everything we write has to be

Sorry, and no, you can't have my writers card.

You know what plotters never tell you? That the real challenge is writing a story where you already know what happens. It's honestly depressing. You guys lied to me. 

This is why this book is filled with angsty betrayal and flirt every because I have to find joy somewhere.

I hate shelving manuscripts but sometimes stories are like relationships. Neither of you are in the right space.

Its OK to walk away, to give it time to breathe. It's still there no matter if you come back in days or years.

And its also OK not to be OK with that.

tweet:
No story starts out perfect.
Every piece needs polishing.
Sometimes you see it, sometimes you... dont.
Sometimes its all so overwhelming you dont know where to start.
But you can start... just like you started writing in the first place, scared, but doing it. You can do this.

It's not just writers block that can stop you writing

Its the uncertainty

Whether or not you're ready to write that big story inside you

So you can either try, or write something else until you're ready

And writing something else isn't giving up; its getting better at writing

Revising a plot
A short story
New website
Book review

Its the little wins that add up

Figuring out which way should be a measure of character, and not an endless list of nos, but it never looks how it should seem, just like hindsight always changes our perspective of the past

Forget true, pure, love.

I want a dark romance.

A villainous couple of unshakeable devotion. Who never doubt each other, always want to bring the hero down, but never at the expense of each other.

Oh and Thursday wasn't as bad as it seemed.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I moved to Melbourne. I found my soulmate & married him. We live together with more pets than we want, and love them all. I have not one, but two books with a US press. I've self published six books. I've written over twenty others. This isn't the end.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet:
Write a message to you five, ten, twenty years ago

Not about the shitty adult things, about the cool things. The great things you thought you'd never do, you didn't dare hope for

Write about the things that would make the you twenty years ago weep in relief and joy

Be that you

tweet: @Claribel_Ortega Its like scents too, your brain is brought back to the moment, and you often don't remember the specifics of what it was, but just how it makes you feel. I do love them when the cheer me up out of the blue, like hearing it at a random store or on a passing car's radio. üòä

tweet:

We live in that torment to give it expression, so when it tracks tears in those that'll listen we find understanding.

tweet:
To my older writer folks who came out/announced their differences later in life cause they didnt feel safe, werent feeling brave, didnt have the space to do so, I hear you.

You arent invalid just because you're older. You just needed more time, & there's nothing wrong with that.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: But when you believe it is you who is wrong, that you've somehow made a mistake, from the script itself right down to who you are, its important to remember to ask around, do your research, see how agents treat their ND authors - or better yet, ask them. You can always ask.

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: I appreciate that it was shared because as someone about to start querying my first ND script I can put that on a list of possible triggers. This industry is hard, anxiety inducing, & difficult to navigate given how much emphasis is placed on things outside the scope of control

name: E. J. Dawson
description: Storyteller| BEHIND THE VEIL (Oct '21), ECHO o/t EVERCRY w @LiteraryWander (Intern)| #SPSFC Judge| #ActuallyAutistic| QoS Trilogy| She/they| Sarcastic witch
tweet: And while I can see many agents and industry professionals coming forward to condemn the actions - Im grateful the author spoke up. ND folk can be blind to the little triggers others see and just knowing it exists, that agents will take your ND script but not you, is important

name: E. J. Dawson
